alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; Coleman; Shackelford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 7:13AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CALLAHAN...NORTHWESTERN BROWN...NORTHERN COLEMAN AND SOUTHEASTERN SHACKELFORD COUNTIES THROUGH 815 AM CST... At 712 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Moran to near Novice. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cross Plains, Moran, Novice, Putnam, Burkett, Atwell, Cross Cut, Rowden, Grosvenor, Silver Valley, Echo, Lake Coleman, I- 20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line, Admiral, and Us- 283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 311 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
